text:
The Divine Dragon 
wakes at last. Clanne and Framme 
rush off to report the news.

The company are attacked by monsters 
in the Lythos grasslands. Clanne and 
Framme find themselves in trouble.

After hearing a voice from within the 
ring and realizing who it must be, 
summons the Emblem.

Emblem Marth and fight 
together to save Clanne and Framme 
from the Corrupted.

Hearing an explosion, 
rushes to the Ring Vault, meeting 
Vander and the others on the way.

Just as has the enemy 
general cornered, the use of a strange 
power turns the tables.

In Lumera's last moments she entrusts 
an Emblem Ring to . They 
vow that they will speak again someday.

Princess Céline is attacked by Corrupted 
foes. Louis and Chloé hold them off and 
urge Céline to rush to Alfred's side.

An Elusian general interrogating Queen 
Ève is interrupted by the arrival of his 
commander, Zephia.

Zephia punishes Nelucce for his failure 
at Firene Castle. She greets a shadowy 
figure.

Prince Alcryst mistakes 
and Alfred for bandits. Upon learning 
their identity, he is mortified at his error.

Princess Hortensia of Elusia is after the 
Emblem Rings. At the Grand Crossing, 
she blocks 's path.

Hortensia reveals her command over a 
Dark Emblem, proving that Fell Dragons 
can also summon Emblems.

Veyle disposes of enemies. Despite her 
success, she feels that she must push 
herself to become even stronger.

Defeated by King Hyacinth, King Morion 
is taken to Elusia. Ivy stands in the way 
of 's rescue attempt.

At Destinea Cathedral, 
confronts King Hyacinth. King Morion 
is revealed to have been Corrupted.

Sombron uses the rings stolen from 
to summon the Emblems 
and turn them to his dark purpose.

Lost and adrift in the Tullah Desert, 
meets Fogado, the 
captain of the Sentinels.

The dancer Seadall is saved from death 
at the hands of the Corrupted by a voice 
offering an escape route.

Florra Mill Town, the once-peaceful 
village of windmills, is set ablaze. Ships 
from Elusia are anchored in the harbor.

Zephia's spell reawakens Veyle's dark 
personality. Accompanied by a Dark 
Emblem, she challenges .

Griss sees summon an 
Emblem with an invocation. He falls into 
a fit of laughter and reveals a secret.

Marni tries, and fails, to destroy the 
device controlling Veyle. Zephia steps in 
to deal with Marni.

In saving Veyle's life, the Divine Dragon 
falls. The dragonstone shatters, and 
Veyle learns the identity of her lost kin.

Veyle battles her dark personality and 
triumphs. Finally under her own control, 
she revives , Corrupted.

After Zephia and Griss are defeated, 
they open up to each other in their final 
moments.

Veyle faces the protector of the final 
shard: Lumera, who has been corrupted 
by Sombron.

At death's door, Lumera regains her 
memories. As she fades into the light, 
says goodbye once more.

The Emblems disappear when Sombron 
closes the portal. At last, 
and allies prepare to make their stand.

Once more, summons 
the 12 Emblems. With the final Emblem 
in place, the showdown begins.

For a brief moment, Sombron appears 
defeated─but with a fearless grin, he 
assumes his true Fell Dragon form.

Emblem Sigurd, summoned from the 
Ring of the Holy Knight.

Emblem Celica, summoned from the 
Ring of the Caring Princess.

Emblem Micaiah, summoned from the 
Ring of the Dawn Maiden.

Emblem Roy, summoned from the 
Ring of the Young Lion.

Emblem Leif, summoned from the 
Ring of the Sage Lord.

Emblem Lyn, summoned from the 
Ring of the Lady of the Plains.

Emblem Lucina, summoned from the 
Ring of the Princess Exalt.

Emblem Ike, summoned from the 
Ring of the Radiant Hero.

Emblem Byleth, summoned from the 
Ring of the Instructor.

Emblem Corrin, summoned from the 
Ring of the Crux of Fate.

Emblem Eirika, summoned from the 
Ring of the Azure Twins.

Divine Dragon dashes 
across a battlefield. Allies and Emblems 
help clear the way to the final battle.

Emblem Marth and 
engage, merging themselves and 
their power to defeat the enemy.

As blue light shines from the ring, the 
swordsman from 's dream 
appears. He calls himself Emblem Marth.

Nearly overwhelmed by enemy numbers, 
is saved by a white 
dragon, who then takes human form.

On the way to Lythos Castle, Lumera 
tells about Elyos and 
Emblems.

A memory of a red-haired warrior 
standing in a burning castle, who smiles 
ominously when questioned by Lumera.

Lythos Castle is under attack by 
enemies unknown. Crown Prince Alfred 
of Firene arrives just in time to assist.

An enemy attacks with 
magic. Lumera blocks it, but after a hard 
battle, it is too much for her to survive.

One of the Corrupted sneak attacks 
, but is defeated by a 
spell cast by a mysterious young girl.

Brodia's crown prince, Diamant, 
greets and company 
at the gates of Brodia Castle.

Ivy, crown princess of Elusia, invades 
Brodia Castle at her father's command, 
demanding the Emblem Rings.

The Brodian and Elusian armies clash. 
King Hyacinth nearly falls to King Morion 
but a Dark Emblem turns the tide.

Sombron regains power from a ritual. He 
is not fully restored, however, and takes 
the blood he needs from King Hyacinth.

Timerra, the crown princess of Solm, 
camps as she wanders the queendom 
alongside her retainers.

The Four Hounds set sail with Veyle, 
who regains her will and throws the Ring 
of the Holy Knight to .

Sombron forsakes Veyle, but just as he 
tries to dispose of her, 
takes the blow in her stead.

Having claimed all of the rings, Sombron 
uses their power to transform himself 
and restore the sunken land of Gradlon.

Even in death, wishes to 
keep fighting. The 12 Emblems grant 
that wish as the Emblems' miracle.

Exhausted in battle, is 
faced with the sight of Sombron, Veyle, 
and a haunting reflection.

After the final battle, lets 
the Emblems know about the upcoming 
coronation, wishing they could be there.
